net.grinder.util
Class Directory

java.lang.Object
  net.grinder.util.Directory
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public final class Directory
extends Object
implements Serializable

Wrapper around a directory path that behaves in a similar manner to java.io.File. Provides utility methods for working with the directory represented by the path.

A Directory be constructed with a path that represents an existing directory, or a path that represents no existing file. The physical directory can be created later using create().

Author:
Philip Aston
See Also:
Serialized Form

          throws Directory.DirectoryException
Constructor.

Parameters:
directory - The directory path upon which this Directory operates.
Throws:
Directory.DirectoryException - If the path directory represents a file that exists but is not a directory.

getFile

public File getFile(File child)
Return a File representing the absolute path of a file in this directory.

Parameters:
child - Relative file in this directory. If null, the result is equivalent to getFile().
Returns:

listContents

public File[] listContents(FileFilter filter)
Equivalent to listContents(filter, false, false).

Parameters:
filter - Filter that controls the files that are returned.
Returns:
The list of files. Files are relative to the directory, not absolute. More deeply nested files are later in the list. The list is empty if the directory does not exist.
See Also:
listContents(FileFilter, boolean, boolean)

listContents

public File[] listContents(FileFilter filter,
                           boolean includeDirectories,
                           boolean absolutePaths)
List the files in the hierarchy below the directory that have been modified after since.

Parameters:
filter - Filter that controls the files that are returned.
includeDirectories - Whether to include directories in the returned files. Only directories that match the filter will be returned.
absolutePaths - Whether returned files should be relative to the directory or absolute.
Returns:
The list of files. More deeply nested files are later in the list. The list is empty if the directory does not exist.

deleteContents

public void deleteContents()
                    throws Directory.DirectoryException
Delete the contents of the directory.

Does nothing if the directory does not exist.

Throws:
Directory.DirectoryException - If a file could not be deleted. The contents of the directory are left in an indeterminate state.
See Also:
delete()

delete

public void delete()
            throws Directory.DirectoryException
Delete the directory. This will fail if the directory is not empty.

Throws:
Directory.DirectoryException - If the directory could not be deleted.
See Also:
deleteContents()

getRelativePath

public File getRelativePath(File file)
Find the given file in the directory and return a File representing its path relative to the root of the directory.

Parameters:
file - The file to search for.
Returns:
The relative file, or null if the directory does not exist or absoluteFile was not found.

isParentOf

public boolean isParentOf(File file)
Test whether a File represents the name of a file that is a descendant of the directory.

Parameters:
file - File to test.
Returns:
boolean => file is a descendant.

copyTo

public void copyTo(Directory target,
                   boolean incremental)
            throws IOException
Copy contents of the directory to the target directory.

Parameters:
target - Target directory.
incremental - true => copy newer files to the directory. false => overwrite the target directory.
Throws:
IOException - If a file could not be copied. The contents of the target directory are left in an indeterminate state.
